intro: Rinorea verrucosa, commonly known as the warty rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, warty stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Rinorea verrucosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
